distributional 0.3.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.05715749 10.05235748
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.275371 0.942066
skewness(dist)
#> [1]  0.33793684 -0.07306719
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  1.045369380  1.723392091  0.573303905 -0.065741964  2.105884331
#>  [6] -0.244727112  0.002069092  1.955380562 -0.565978699 -0.010569606
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  8.831805 10.339878 10.612477  8.867626  9.557843  8.808797  9.947049
#>  [8] 10.472779 11.044075 10.115580
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2129757 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.05590383  9.84500784
variance(dist)
#>            [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,] 1.06229902 0.03995491
#> [2,] 0.03995491 0.97933844
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.005580738
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,]  0.74634356 10.160850
#>  [2,] -1.14838845 12.529325
#>  [3,]  1.16481818 10.236206
#>  [4,] -0.06925327  9.589019
#>  [5,]  0.09751491 10.709971
#>  [6,]  1.16481818 10.236206
#>  [7,]  1.42038741  9.182078
#>  [8,] -0.85129409  9.682913
#>  [9,] -0.26054313 11.021228
#> [10,] -0.06925327  9.589019
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2211925 0.0000000
